title: Arnold's Logo - What the font??
content:
I've looked through script and handwritten fonts until I'm seeing them in my sleep -- Veer, MyFonts, Fontshop, etc.

Any leads on what font this might be? Or where I might search for a font like this.

It's just so appropriate for a logo I'm working on -- friendly and retro, but strong, clean and legible.

Do you think it was hand rendered?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120301010733im_/http:/typophile.com/files/arnolds_logo_4152.jpg)
author: DesignGuyMemphis

comments.content:
Design Guy

I would say custom. There are variations in the exit strokes of the letters that lead me to that conclusion. Plus the weights and x-heights are all over the place. But with open type I could end up with egg on my face as opposed to bread.

Michael
You might like [MVB Emmascript](http://web.archive.org/web/20120301010733/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/mvb_fonts/emmascript_bold/), though it's a little more rough and wobbly.
